title: Fall Books: Nonfiction
sub_head: American history takes the stage in a parade of new books.
body: Even in the midst of a frenetic year of news, it’s been hard to miss the headlines about statues coming down in cities and on college campuses around the country. Beyond the front pages, though, historians continue their more measured engagement with the complex people who did so much to shape this nation’s past. Among the noteworthy books our reviewers highlight this season are reconsiderations of some of the figures—and flashpoints—that still define (and sometimes divide) America and Americans.
